intro: Kochia scoparia var. sieversiana, commonly known as the Russian spinach or garden spinach, is a flowering plant in the amaranth family. It is an annual herb that typically grows to a height of 30–90 cm, featuring triangular, lobed leaves and vividly colored bracts that range from red to purple. The plant is native to Europe and parts of Asia but has been naturalized in various regions around the world. Its seeds are small and produce a fluffy, cotton-like coating, aiding in wind dispersal. It is often cultivated as a ornamental plant due to its striking fall coloration.
